course_title: Fresh Sem: Women, Gender, & Sexuality Studies: Buddhist Women Thru the Ages
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 7 / Seats Avail: 0Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as REL 190 1)
(This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement: - Theme, Tradition-Buddhism.)
This course is designed to teach skills for research in the humanities through an investigation of women in Buddhism. Comparing ancient texts with contemporary narratives, students will learn to discern appropriate sources to construct arguments in written and oral forms. A focus will be on the question of evidence, what counts for good evidence and how to use it in humanities research. The materials we will engage will be both delightful and challenging, and will open our eyes to new ways of engaging with history, literature, religion, and gender.)
course_description: For first-year students only. Entry level seminar focusing on a specific topic.
